He then transitioned into acquisition roles, serving as an Experimental Test Pilot (XP) at the Aviation Applied Technology Directorate (AATD). He is DAWIA-certified in Program Management (Advanced) and Test & Evaluation (Practitioner) and holds a Master of Science in Engineering Systems from the Naval Postgraduate School.

His acquisition assignments include Assistant Program Manager/XP at the Aviation Integration Directorate, Team Lead/XP for the Rotorcraft In-Flight Laboratory, Product Manager for the MH-47G at the Technology Applications Program Office (TAPO), Chief of Aviation Experimentation/XP at the Technology Development Directorate-Aviation, and TAPO Project Manager.

COL Cleary is qualified in multiple aircraft, including the OH-58A/C/D, CH-47D/F, MH-47G, H-60A/L/M, UH-72, C-12, and T-34C. His military awards and decorations reflect his distinguished career.

He and his wife, Stephanie, are proud parents of two children, Peyton (16) and William (12).

name: Lieutenant Colonel Thomas Brewington
title: Product Manager, MH-47
bio:
Commissioned as an Aviation Officer in 2004, Tom completed nine years of aviation service in a wide range of operational aviation assignments from platoon to brigade level in the 12th Combat Aviation Brigade and 101st Combat Aviation Brigade and deployed twice in support of the Global War on Terrorism. After joining the Army Acquisition Corps in 2013, Tom served as the Branch Chief for Aircraft Survivability Equipment (ASE) under TRADOC Program Office – Aviation Brigades (TPO–AB), responsible for the development and staffing of critical ASE requirement documents.

Tom completed his key developmental acquisition assignment in PEO Intelligence, Electronic Warfare and Sensors (IEW&S) as the Assistant Product Manager, Army Tactical Exploration of National Capabilities (TENCAP), where he supported the development of counter-unmanned aircraft system (C-UAS) capabilities in support of CENTCOM joint-urgent operational requirements. To further broaden his skillset, Tom served on the Army Special Operations Aviation Command (ARSOAC) Headquarters staff assigned to the G-8 Directorate, where he provided acquisition expertise in support of resource development and requirements generation/validation.

Prior to joining TAPO as the MH-47G Product Manager, Tom served as both Assistant Product Lead and eventually Product Lead for the Scout/Attack portfolio under the Multi-National Aviation Special Project Office (MASPO), PEO-Aviation, where he led a team of acquisition professionals responsible for providing global non-standard rotary wing support through Foreign Military Sales.

Tom grew up in Pembroke, North Carolina, where he earned a Bachelor of Science in Business Administration and received his commission in the Reserve Officers’ Training Corps. Tom is a graduate of the US Army Command and General Staff College and holds a Master of Science in Supply Chain Management and Logistics from The University of Kansas. He is certified Advanced (formerly Level III) in Program Management and is a member of the Army Acquisition Corps.

LTC Brewington’s military awards and decorations are complementary of a military officer with similar time in grade and experience.

name: Mr. Paul Kylander
title: Product Manager, A/MH-6 Little Bird
bio:
Mr. Kylander is a distinguished leader in aerospace engineering and program management with over two decades of experience. He holds a Bachelor of Science in Electrical Engineering from the University of Victoria and a Master of Science in Systems Engineering Management from the Naval Postgraduate School. His professional certifications include Level III in Program Management and Engineering, Level I in Information Technology, and a Systems Engineering certificate.

Beginning his career in 2000 at Rockwell Collins, Mr. Kylander contributed to the development of the Common Avionics Architecture System (CAAS) cockpit, supporting the successful fielding of the MH-47 and MH-60 systems for the 160th Special Operations Aviation Regiment (SOAR). In 2003, he joined Honeywell as lead systems engineer for the EGI+429+JAIC program, helping deliver critical embedded GPS and navigation units for SOAR platforms.

In 2006, Mr. Kylander transitioned to the Technology Applications Program Office (TAPO) as a support contractor and later entered government service as an Aerospace Engineer in 2008. During his decade in TAPO's Mission Equipment Avionics office, he oversaw the release of 10 major CAAS software updates and key tactical networking advancements. In 2018, he became Deputy Product Manager for the MH-60 team, successfully managing the delivery of 10 MH-60M aircraft and helping establish TAPO’s Future Vertical Lift office.

He returned to the Mission Equipment office as Deputy Product Manager in 2020 before assuming the Charter of the A/MH-6 Office on May 5, 2022. As Product Manager, he has led multiple platform configuration changes and overseen the delivery of over 30 aircraft from multiple production lines, including managing the delivery of the first A/MH-6R, a newly designated variant for the platform.

Throughout his career, Mr. Kylander has demonstrated exceptional leadership, technical expertise, and a commitment to advancing critical aviation capabilities for the special operations community.

name: Lieutenant Colonel John Williams
title: Product Manager, SOF Training Systems
bio:
LTC John M. Williams II is an Army acquisition officer with 20 years of service on active duty. Since transitioning to the Army Acquisition Corps, LTC Williams has led teams in developing, procuring, and fielding advanced virtual training systems; leading science and technology portfolio integration at the DEVCOM Chem Bio Center; and leading a team of science advisors to Army units in the INDO-PACIFIC theater.

LTC Williams currently serves as Product Manager of Forces Training Systems, where he leads efforts to mature and acquire training solutions for Special Operators, Army Intelligence, and Opposition Forces at combat training centers.

He earned a BS in Chemistry from the United States Military Academy, an MA in Leadership from the University of Texas at El Paso, an MS in Biomedical Engineering from the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill, and a PhD in Material Science from Vanderbilt University.

name: Lieutenant Colonel Cameron Keogh
title: Product Manager, MH-60/FVL and Launched Effects

name: General Dan Caine
title: Chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff
bio:
General Dan Caine is the 22nd Chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff, the nation’s highest-ranking military officer, and the principal military advisor to the President, Secretary of Defense, and National Security Council.

Prior to becoming Chairman on April 11, 2025, General Caine was the Associate Director for Military Affairs at Central Intelligence Agency.

He has served in a wide range of operational, staff and joint assignments, primarily as an F-16 fighter pilot, weapons officer, member of the White House staff and special operations officer.

General Caine was commissioned in 1990 through the ROTC program at the Virginia Military Institute, and he has an MA in Air Warfare from the American Military University. He has completed a range of national security and leadership courses, including Harvard Kennedy School's course for Senior Executives in National and International Security, and the Syracuse University Maxwell School's Program on National Security.

As a Command Pilot, he has logged more than 2,800 hours in the F-16, including more than 150 combat hours. From 2009-2016, Caine was a part-time member of the National Guard and a serial entrepreneur and investor.

name: Dr. Joe Register
title: Vice President of R&D
bio:
Dr. Joe Register is a dynamic technical entrepreneur and engineer with two decades of experience developing cutting-edge technologies for defense and aerospace applications. His career has been defined by a relentless drive to prototype, develop, and commercialize mission-critical systems, particularly for the Department of Defense (DoD).

After earning his B.S. in Electrical Engineering from the University of South Florida (USF) in 2008, Joe joined Lockheed Martin, where he worked on mission-critical space and defense systems, gaining deep expertise in designing and engineering complex, highly reliable technologies.

His passion for pushing technological boundaries led him to pursue a Ph.D. in Electrical Engineering at USF, focusing on Brain-Machine Interfaces and silicon carbide bioelectronics interfaces—research with significant implications for defense and military applications.

In 2016, Joe joined Draper Labs as a Senior Member of Technical Staff, overseeing projects in bioelectronics, optics, and robotics. He played a key role in developing neurostimulation devices, augmented reality displays, and next-generation defense technologies for SOCOM, frequently collaborating with DARPA and other government agencies.

By 2021, Joe co-founded Tribe Aerospace Corporation to revolutionize UAV and drone technology for military applications. Under his leadership, Tribe developed modular, mission-adaptive drone platforms, growing to nearly 200 employees before being acquired by AEVEX Aerospace in 2022.

Today, Joe serves as the Vice President of R&D at AEVEX Tactical Systems, leading advancements in unmanned systems and next-generation defense technologies. His expertise spans research, prototyping, and large-scale implementation, making him a key innovator in DoD technology development.

name: Mr. Alex Clark
title: Senior Technical Director for all Autonomy
bio:
Alex Clark is the Senior Director of Advanced Innovation at BlueHalo, where he leads strategic development across all-domain mission areas, including Counter-Uncrewed Systems (UxS), Autonomous Platforms, and Integrated Defense Technologies. With a focus on operational relevance and rapid fielding, Alex drives the transition of emerging technologies into deployable capabilities for complex threat environments.

A graduate of The University of Alabama in Huntsville with degrees in mechanical and electrical enginering, Alex combines a strong engineering foundation with firsthand experience leading cross-functional teams in the development of advanced sensing, targeting, autonomy, and kinetic effect systems. His work spans domains—from CUAS and autonomous ISR to layered maritime sensing and counter-surface strategies.

Known for integrating cutting-edge solutions at the speed of relevance, Alex works closely with end-users, technologists, and acquisition leaders to ensure BlueHalo delivers disruptive capabilities across today’s multidomain battlespace.

name: Mr. Andrew Howard
title: Vice President, Corporate Capabilities and Solutions
bio:
Andrew Howard is Vice President of Corporate Capabilities and Offerings at Astrion, where he works closely with the Growth organization to define and deliver differentiated solutions for government customers. He leads the Solution Architecture team, which plays a critical role in bridging innovation and execution—ensuring that Astrion’s cutting-edge technologies, including those developed through IR&D, are seamlessly integrated into capture strategies and proposal efforts.

Andrew brings deep experience in delivering advanced technologies for the Department of Defense. Prior to joining Astrion, he was Senior Director of Unmanned Surface Vessel and Autonomy Programs at Huntington Ingalls Industries, where he led programs spanning small craft to 200+ foot vessels for the U.S. Navy and other government agencies.

Previously, he served as Cognitive Solutions Chief Architect at Perspecta, where he shaped the company’s approach to machine learning and artificial intelligence. He has also managed multi-million-dollar technology portfolios for national security customers at ByteCubed and ManTech International.

Andrew holds an MBA from the Wharton School with a focus on strategic leadership and product development, as well as an MS in Aerospace Engineering from Georgia Tech and a BS in Aerospace Engineering from the University of Maryland.

name: Mr. Austin Branch
bio:
Austin Branch is the founder of Crescent Bridge Corporation, supporting the technical, information, and cognitive security needs of the U.S. government, commercial enterprises, and international partners. He also serves as a Visiting Professor of Practice at the University of Maryland’s Applied Research Laboratory for Intelligence & Security (ARLIS), where he contributes to applied research in information, cyber, media, and cognitive science.

Commissioned as an Infantry Officer in 1986 from The Citadel, Austin became the U.S. Army’s first Information Operations Officer. Over his military career, he held key leadership roles within the Army, Joint Special Operations Command, Joint Staff, National Security Staff, and U.S. European Command, and deployed with joint and multinational task forces worldwide.

After retiring from the Army, Austin served as Deputy Director and Chief of Operations for the Defense Policy Analysis Office within the Office of the Under Secretary of Defense for Intelligence. He was later appointed as a Senior Executive Leader, where he oversaw Defense Information Operations, policy, and special programs. In 2010, he was selected by the Secretary of Defense to lead the Department’s Information Operations and Military Information Support Enterprise.

In 2013, Austin was appointed by the Director of National Intelligence to lead a new domestic counterterrorism and cyber policy initiative in support of the National Security Council, including serving as the national co-lead for countering ISIS propaganda. He is recognized for innovative collaborations with the entertainment and gaming industries to align emerging technologies with national security objectives.

Austin co-founded the Information Professionals Association (IPA), a nonprofit organization dedicated to advancing cognitive security and the global information community. He has served on the Defense Science Board and continues to advise on strategic competition in the information environment. A frequent speaker, he participates in academic and professional forums worldwide.

name: Major General Jason C. Slider
title: Commanding General, John F. Kennedy Special Warfare Center and School, the Special Operations Center

name: Mr. Kennan Hedrick
title: Principal Director, Information Operations Policy
company: Office of the Secretary of Defense (OSD) Policy
bio:
Kennan F. Hedrick is the Principal Director for Information Operations Policy in the Office of the Secretary of Defense (OSD) Policy.

He supports the Executive Director in leading Department of Defense (DoD) information operations strategy and policy, coordinating adversary and capability influence guidance, leading the Strategic Information Oversight Board, and managing Military Information Support Operations policy and resources.

Prior to this role, Kennan served as Director for Global Posture Policy in OSD Policy, where he was responsible for developing DoD's strategic guidance for global posture, leading policy recommendations for the Secretary on posture adjustments and supporting resources, and coordinating posture-related engagements with the interagency, Congress, and allies and partners. Kennan led the presidentially directed 2021 Global Posture Review, which reduced the deployment of high-stressed force elements in the Middle East, implemented strategic-level posture improvements in the Indo-Pacific and Europe, and informed the 2022 National Defense Strategy and the 2023 Guidance for Employment of the Force.

Kennan previously held positions in OSD Policy covering Iraq, Syria, Japan, and Russia, along with external assignments in the Joint Staff and U.S. Department of State. He also serves as a Foreign Area Officer in the Army Reserve and previously served as an active-duty field artillery officer in Germany and Afghanistan.

Kennan is a Term Member with the Council on Foreign Relations. He holds a B.A. in Peace, War, and Defense from the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill, an M.A. in International Affairs from The George Washington University, and an M.A. in National Security Strategy from the National War College.

name: Captain Donald Wetherbee
title: Vice Deputy Director, Global Operations
bio:
Captain Don Wetherbee graduated from the U.S. Naval Academy in 1997 and completed a Master’s degree in Joint Campaign Planning and Strategy at the Joint Advanced Warfighting School (JAWS).

His command tours include SEAL Team FOUR, Special Operations Task Force – East Africa, Naval Special Warfare Development Group – Technical Support Squadron, Joint Special Operations Task Force – Somalia, and Naval Special Warfare Group TWO. He also commanded the Joint Force Special Operations Component Command (JFSOCC) during the withdrawal from Somalia.

His operational tours include USS Ford, MCM Rotational Crew Foxtrot (USS Gladiator and USS Dextrous), SEAL Team TWO/EIGHT (Platoon and Troop Commander, Operations Officer, Executive Officer), and NSW Group TWO (Operations Officer, Chief of Staff).

His staff assignments include Deputy J39 on the Joint Staff, Director of the Joint Information Operations Warfare Center, J5 for Special Operations Joint Task Force – Afghanistan, C5 for NATO Special Operations Component Command – Afghanistan, J3 for Joint Task Force 48-4, Joint Staff J3 Directorate for Special Operations as the PACOM/EUCOM/AFRICOM Branch Chief, and Deputy Executive Assistant to the Commander, U.S. Fleet Forces Command.

Captain Wetherbee is married to Tamara, and they have three children: Hal (21), Sydney (18), and Alexandra (16).

name: Dr. Todd Helmus
title: Senior Behavioral Scientist; Professor of Policy Analysis
bio:
Todd Helmus is a senior behavioral scientist at RAND and a professor of policy analysis at the RAND School of Public Policy.  He is nationally recognized expert on irregular warfare, terrorism, and information operations. Helmus has studied approaches to counter a variety of irregular threats to the U.S. to include foreign terrorist recruitment and propaganda, Chinese maritime gray zone tactics, and adversary propaganda campaigns and deepfakes.

In addition to his research, Todd has served as a deployed analyst to U.S. military commands in Iraq and Afghanistan, he teaches graduate level courses on information operations and serves as a frequent speaker at security and online safety conferences.

Helmus holds a Ph.D. in clinical psychology from Wayne State University, Detroit, MI.

name: Mr. Brian Murphy
title: President
bio:
Brian Murphy is an Associate Managing Director at Kroll Associates’ Data and Cyber Security division. In this role, he assists federal and private sector clients in designing, implementing, and modifying end-to-end cyber solutions.

Prior to Kroll, Murphy was the Managing Director for Logically.ai. There, he assisted in developing and implementing advanced Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence solutions to find harmful threat content at scale and across languages and internet platforms.

Before joining Logically, Murphy served as both the Principal and Acting Under Secretary for Intelligence at the Department of Homeland Security (DHS). Murphy was a special agent with the FBI for 20 years. While there, he performed duties ranging from street agent to national manager in the Senior Executive Service. During his career, he served in New York, Afghanistan, Algeria, Tunisia, Niger, Pittsburgh, Chicago, and Washington, DC.

Murphy began his federal service in 1994 as an officer in the U.S. Marine Corps and later returned to active duty in 2004 to serve in Iraq.

Murphy has been an adjunct professor in Georgetown’s Security Studies Program, where he teaches homeland security and the domestic intelligence architecture underpinning national security.

As of 2022, Murphy has been a member of DHS’s Election Infrastructure Committee, and in 2024 was elected to its executive committee. In 2023, he joined Pitt Cyber as an Affiliate Practice Scholar, where he collaborates with researchers and industry professionals.

Murphy is also the President of the non-profit Information Professionals Association, which is focused on cognitive security.

His academic credentials include a PhD from Georgetown University, an MA from Columbia University, and a BA from William & Mary. He is a certified U.S. Intelligence Officer, Joint Duty Certified, and maintains a Top Secret clearance. Murphy is the author of several books and peer-reviewed journal articles.

name: Colonel Antonio di Leonardo
title: Commander, PSYOPS Regiment
bio:
Colonel Antonio DI LEONARDO enrolled in the Italian Army in 1995, joining the Army Academy. Successive postings have taken his from the 5th Anti-aircraft Artillery to the 28th Army PSYOPS Regiment, notably to undertake a range of Command and staff duties such as those of Army Antiaircraft Company, Tactical Air Defense Control Officer, PSYOPS Company Commander, Operations at the PSYOPS Regiment, General Planning Staff Officer and Doctrine Officer at the Army HQ, PSYOPS Battalion Commander, NATO Deputy Supreme Allied Commander Transformation Executive Assistant.

Colonel Antonio DI LEONARDO has also performed the duties of PSYOPS Analyst at the Multinational Division "Salamandre" - Mission SFOR (Bosnia and Herzegovina); PSYOPS Media Analyst at the Multinational Brigade South West - Mission KFOR (Kosovo); Tactical PSYOPS Company Commander at the Multinational Command West and Operations Staff Officer - Mission ISAF (Afghanistan), Unite Nations Line Military Observer at the United Nations Truce Supervision Organization (UNTSO) in Israel and in Lebanon and UNTSO Observer Group Lebanon Chief of Operations (Lebanon).

Colonel Antonio DI LEONARDO has a Bachelor in Political Sciences from Turin's University, a Bachelor in International Relationship from Trieste's University and a Masters in Strategic Defense Studies from the Rome III University. He is also a graduate of the Command and Staff Course at the Army School of Application in Turin and of the Advanced Military Studies Course at the Military Joint defense College. He was awarded several NATO and UN Medals for the abovementioned services in SFOR, KFOR, ISAF, UNTSO, UNTSO OGL, UNDOF ISAF HQ. He is highly qualified in Air Defense, PSYOPS and STRATCOM.

Colonel Antonio DI LEONARDO was promoted to his current rank on 1 January 2021. On 7th October 2022, he was appointed to his current duty as Commander of the Italian Army PSYOPS Regiment.

name: Lieutenant Colonel Jason Hasbrouck
title: Deputy Division Chief, Information Operations, Headquarters Air Force
bio:
Lt Col Jason Hasbrouck, PhD serves as the Deputy 14F Career Field Functional Manager and Deputy Chief of the Information Operations Division within the Spectrum, Information, and Cyber Effects Operations Directorate at Headquarters Air Force, the Pentagon. In this role, he shapes strategy, policy, guidance, and resource advocacy for Information Operations, including Operations Security, Military Information Support Operations (MISO), and Deception Activities in support of the Air Force’s core missions and Joint warfighting objectives.

Previously, Lt Col Hasbrouck served as Chief of MISO Policy and Assessments at U.S. Special Operations Command (USSOCOM) J39, where he led global strategic-level research and assessments of Military Information Support Operations. Over his 17-year career as an Information Operations Officer, he has held key roles in public affairs, research, and strategic communication. His assignments include leading research at Headquarters Air Force Public Affairs to shape communication strategy for the Secretary of the Air Force and conducting scientific research at the Air Force Research Laboratory during two separate tours.

Lt Col Hasbrouck also served as a White House Social Aide during the Obama Administration.

He holds a PhD in Social, Decision, and Organizational Psychology from the University of Maryland, College Park. His academic research focused on the psychological motivations behind terrorism and extreme violence.

name: Colonel Alphanso Adams ​
title: Division Chief, J3 Cyber and Electronic Warfare, Directorate of Operations
bio:
Colonel Alphanso Adams is a National Security Affairs Fellow for academic year 2023–2024 at the Hoover Institution. Previously, he was the Commander of the 561st Network Operations Squadron at Peterson Space Force Base, Colorado.

Colonel Adams is a career Cyberspace Operations Officer. A graduate of Baylor University in Waco, Texas, he commissioned through the Reserve Officer Training Corps in May 2004. He has led teams as a Flight Commander, Assistant Director of Operations, Branch Chief, Division Chief, and Squadron Commander.

Colonel Adams has also served as a strategist in the Department of the Air Force Rapid Capabilities Office, Military Liaison for then-Senator Bill Nelson of Florida during the 115th Congress, and a fellow at the Hoover Institution at Stanford University.

He and his wife, Regina, are the proud parents of three boys – Kai, Bryce, and Austin.

name: Ms. Virginia McCabe
title: Director,
bio:
Ms. Ginny McCabe serves as the Director of J10 for Allied Special Operations Forces Command (SOFCOM), a role she has held since March 2021 following her retirement from the U.S. Army. In this position, she leads strategic communication initiatives encompassing public affairs, psychological operations, and information operations, and advises senior leadership on media engagement and outreach strategies in support of SOFCOM’s mission and NATO’s broader operational objectives.

Previously, Ms. McCabe served as the Public Affairs Officer to the Supreme Allied Commander Europe (SACEUR) and as Deputy Public Affairs Officer at Supreme Headquarters Allied Powers Europe (SHAPE). Throughout her 26-year military career, she served as a public affairs officer at all levels within the 82nd Airborne Division and in support of Operations Enduring Freedom and Iraqi Freedom.

A native of Appleton, Wisconsin, Ms. McCabe commissioned into the U.S. Army in June 1995 through the Army ROTC program at the University of Wisconsin–Oshkosh. She holds a Bachelor's degree in English and Sports and Leisure Management from Marian University in Fond du Lac, Wisconsin, and a Master’s degree in Human Resource Management from Webster University.

name: Mr. David Breede
title: Program Executive Officer for Tactical Information Systems, PEO (TIS)
